info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 5:58PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Teton County through 645 PM MDT... At 558 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Fairfield, or 10 miles southeast of Choteau, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Choteau. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
